result.execSummary:
The defendant Onjuan C Guyton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carrying Concealed Weapon. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Onjuan C Guyton

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Onjuan C Guyton in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a Status Conference. Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered:     
Charge amended to Carry Concealed Weapon Citation pursuant to s. 63.015 Wis. Stats. to which Defendant plead no contest. 
Court finds defendant guilty of amended charge.  Court orders a forfeiture in the amount of $50.00 including costs to be paid by 11-08-2022. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

Defendant Onjuan C Guyton in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Case calendared for Status Conference this date.  Court does not have a reporter this morning.  Matter adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Onjuan C Guyton in court via Zoom with attorney Haley E Wentz.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Status conference held.  Atty. Wentz has just received an offer and requests time to review it with her client.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Onjuan C Guyton in court.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Hearing held via Zoom and live streamed through DA Cast.  Matter set for pretrial conference.  Defendant is currently not working and may qualify for a public defender.  Court ordered the defendant to contact the SPD office to see if he does qualify now.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Status conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 03/17/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Onjuan C Guyton in court.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 1.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/15/22 @ 2:30p
